top.title: AI in universities: What is driving professors to develop custom assistants?
top.snippet: Universities are grappling with generative AI. Some ban it, others embrace it. Professors at George Washington University are creating custom AI teaching assistants. These tools help students with research and writing. This approach aims to teach AI literacy responsibly. It offers a controlled environment for learning.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Professors at George Washington University are developing custom AI teaching assistants to help students with research and writing, aiming to teach AI literacy responsibly in a controlled learning environment amidst universities' varying approaches to generative AI.

top.title: Alarm in Germany over AI holocaust imagery
top.snippet: Germany's government and Holocaust memorial institutions have demanded social ‍media platforms stop the spread ​of fake images which they say are distorting and trivialising ⁠history.
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Germany's government and Holocaust memorial institutions are alarmed by the spread of fake images on social media platforms that distort and trivialize history, particularly related to the Holocaust.

top.title: California AG sends letter demanding xAI stop producing deekfake content

California AG Robert Bonta has issued a cease and desist letter to xAI, demanding they halt the production and distribution of AI-generated non-consensual sexualized content through their Grok AI chatbot.

top.title: AGI? GPUs? Learn the definitions of the most common AI terms to enter our vocabulary
top.snippet:
Companies of all sizes are looking to hire workers who know how to use AI.
Sebastien Bozon/Getty Images

Do you know what LLM even is? How about a GPU? A new vocabulary has emerged with the rise of AI.
From AGI to prompt engineering, new terms and concepts are being created seemingly every day.
Use this glossary of AI-related terms to speak about this technology with authority.

It's becoming increasingly impossible to ignore AI in our everyday lives.
That doesn't mean it's always easy to unders...
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: A glossary of AI-related terms is essential as companies seek workers knowledgeable in AI, with terms like AGI and GPU becoming common in the evolving AI vocabulary.

top.title: Boston Dynamics CEO told us how the humanoid robot revolution begins
top.snippet:
Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter talked to Business Insider about how humanoid robots will transform the factory workplace.
Sophia Tung

Boston Dynamics revealed the latest iteration of Atlas, a 200-pound, six-foot-tall humanoid robot.
The company plans to deploy Atlas on the Hyundai factory floor by 2028.
Business Insider spoke to Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter about the new robot.

In a few years, factory employees at Hyundai's massive Georgia plant could be getting a new coworker.
It's ...
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter discussed how humanoid robots, like the latest Atlas model, will revolutionize factory workplaces, with plans to deploy Atlas at Hyundai by 2028.

top.title: Chinese AI firm trains state-of-the-art model entirely on Huawei chips
top.snippet:
Chinese company Zhipu AI has trained image generation model entirely on Huawei processors, demonstrating that Chinese firms can build competitive AI systems without access to advanced Western chips.
The model, released on Tuesday, marks the first time a state-of-the-art multimodal model completed its full training cycle on Chinese-made chips, Zhipu said in a statement. The Beijing-based company trained the model on Huawei’s Ascend Atlas 800T A2 devices using the MindSpore AI framework, completin...
top.aiSummary: AI firm Zhipu AI in China has successfully trained a state-of-the-art image generation model entirely on Huawei chips, showcasing the ability of Chinese companies to develop competitive AI systems without relying on Western technology. This achievement marks the first time a multimodal model has completed its full training cycle on Chinese-made chips, using Huawei's Ascend Atlas 800T A2 devices and the MindSpore AI framework.

top.title: Yea or nay: Will Nvidia H200 chips go to China?
top.snippet:
In what appears to be a case of diplomatic mind games in action, one day after the US government issued a regulation clearing the way for Nvidia to sell its H200 artificial intelligence processors to Chinese companies on a case-by-case basis, a published report has revealed Chinese custom officers have been told not to let them into the country.
The ruling announced Monday by the US commerce department’s Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS), the primary agency that oversees export controls, rep...
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
The US government allows Nvidia to sell H200 chips to Chinese companies on a case-by-case basis, but Chinese custom officers have been instructed not to allow them into the country, creating uncertainty about the chips' fate in China.

top.title: AI adoption outpaces training; 71% professionals expect role changes: Report
top.snippet: Artificial Intelligence is rapidly changing workplaces. Many professionals expect their jobs to evolve significantly in the coming years due to AI. However, a large number feel their companies are not providing adequate training on AI tools. This lack of guidance leads to uncertainty about AI's role.
top.aiSummary: AI adoption is surpassing training efforts in the workplace, with 71% of professionals anticipating role changes due to AI. Many feel their companies are not providing sufficient training on AI tools, leading to uncertainty about the technology's impact on their jobs.

top.title: ChatGPT's free ride is ending: Here's what OpenAI plans for advertising on the chatbot
top.snippet: OpenAI says it will soon start showing advertisements to ChatGPT users who aren't paying for a premium version of the chatbot. The artificial intelligence company said Friday it hasn't yet rolled out ads but will start testing them in the coming weeks.
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
OpenAI will introduce advertisements to ChatGPT users without a premium subscription, with testing set to begin in the upcoming weeks, as reported by the Economic Times on January 17, 2026.

top.title: EXL eyes two new India centres as AI spend set to rise in 2026
top.snippet: Exlservice Holdings is set to open two new centers in smaller Indian cities this year. The data and AI company aims to tap into better infrastructure and talent outside major metros. This expansion aligns with rising global IT spends focused on AI, infrastructure, and cybersecurity.

top.title: Saks Global Has Filed for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
top.snippet: SummarySaks Global has filed for voluntary Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to manage its debt load after failing to meet a significant interest payment due at the end of DecemberFormer Neiman Marcus head Geoffroy van Raemdonck has been appointed as the new CEO to lead the restructuring effort, taking over the role from Richard BakerSupported by $1.75 billion USD in new debtor-in-possession financing, the company plans to keep all Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus, and Bergdorf Goodman locations ...
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Saks Global has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy to address its debt, with Geoffroy van Raemdonck appointed as the new CEO for the restructuring. The company plans to maintain its Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus, and Bergdorf Goodman locations with $1.75 billion in new financing.

top.title: 50 Cent Finalizes $124 Million USD Deal to Build a Southern Entertainment Hub in Louisiana
top.snippet: SummaryCurtis “50 Cent” Jackson and his G-Unit Studios have finalized a landmark $124 million USD agreement with the state of Louisiana to transform downtown Shreveport into a premier national destination for film, music, and digital media.The multi-phase redevelopment includes the modernization of the Millennium Studios campus, the renovation of the Stageworks facility for live events, and the groundbreaking construction of a "G-Dome" immersive venue and public green spaceSupported by $50 milli...

top.title: Richemont Defies Market Headwinds with Record-Breaking $7.4 Billion USD Quarter
top.snippet: SummaryRichemont achieved a record-shattering $7.43 billion USD in Q3 sales, driven by an 11 percent revenue surge that significantly outpaced analyst expectations during the 2025 holiday seasonThe conglomerate saw robust growth in the U.S. and Middle East, while the Hong Kong market emerged as a critical driver of demand, helping the jewelry division reach a 14% increase despite high gold prices and Swiss trade tariffsBrand heat was further fueled by high-profile celebrity ambassadors, includin...
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Richemont reported a record-breaking $7.43 billion USD in Q3 sales, driven by strong revenue growth in the U.S., Middle East, and Hong Kong markets, with the jewelry division seeing a 14% increase despite challenges like high gold prices and Swiss trade tariffs. Celebrity ambassadors also contributed to the brand's success.

top.title: Saks Global Bankruptcy Reveals Multi-Million Dollar Debts to Luxury Icons, Chanel, Kering and More
top.snippet: SummarySaks Global’s bankruptcy filing reveals over $700 million USD in debt owed to its largest unsecured creditors, with iconic luxury houses like Chanel ($136 million USD) and Kering ($60 million USD) topping the listThe financial instability is particularly devastating for smaller, independent designers, many of whom rely on the retailer for nearly half of their total business and are currently facing millions in unpaid vendor claimsDespite the massive liabilities, major brands are expected ...
top.aiSummary: AI-Generated Summary: Saks Global's bankruptcy filing exposes debts of over $700 million USD to luxury brands like Chanel and Kering, impacting smaller designers reliant on the retailer for a significant portion of their business.

top.title: India moves to protect natural diamonds; government mandate issued
top.snippet: The Indian gem and jewellery industry has successfully lobbied for the introduction of a national standard governing diamond terminology, reserving the term ‘diamond’ exclusively for natural diamonds and requiring explicit disclosure for laboratory-grown alternatives.
top.rerankWhy: New regulations affecting diamond terminology and sales
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
India's gem and jewellery industry has secured a government mandate establishing a national standard to protect natural diamonds by reserving the term 'diamond' for them and mandating disclosure for lab-grown alternatives.

top.title: TAG Heuer CEO Exits, Adding to LVMH Watches Woes
